fifteen

Class Puzzle

  • java.lang.Object
    • fifteen.Puzzle

  • public class Puzzle
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains the value storage and algorithms for a fifteen puzzle.
    Author:
    Melissa Thai. Created Sep 27, 2013.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Puzzle(int rows, int cols)
      Constructs the puzzles gameBoard with "rows" rows and "cols" columns.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void generatePuzzle()
      Generates a random solvable puzzle.
      int[][] generateSolution()
      Generates and returns a solution based off of the size of this gameboard
      boolean isSolved()
      This checks if the puzzle is solved
      boolean makeMove(int fromX, int fromY)
      Makes a move from the given (x,y) coordinate to the blank space, if possible.
      void makeRandomMove()
      Randomly swaps the blank space with an adjacent space.
      void redo()
      Makes the last "undone" move.
      boolean redoable()
      Checks to see if there are redos to be made.
      int[][] returnPuzzle()
      Returns this Puzzle's gameBoard.
      void setToSolution()
      Resets the gameBoard to the solved state.
      void undo()
      Reverts the gameboard to the state before the previous move and adds the "undone" move to the stack of moves that can be "redone."

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • undo

        public void undo()
        Reverts the gameboard to the state before the previous move and adds the "undone" move to the stack of moves that can be "redone."

        Makes the last "undone" move.
